paragraphs.text:
%md
## Welcome to the MongoDB Spark Connector - it's SQL time!
##### This is a live tutorial, you can run the code yourself. (Shift-Enter to Run)

result.msg:
Welcome to the MongoDB Spark Connector - it's SQL time!

This is a live tutorial, you can run the code yourself. (Shift-Enter to Run)

paragraphs.title: Basic Configuration
paragraphs.text:
import com.mongodb.spark._
import com.mongodb.spark.config._

val readConfig = ReadConfig(Map("uri" -> "mongodb://mongodb:27017/sparkDemo.bank"))
val writeConfig = WriteConfig(Map("uri" -> "mongodb://mongodb:27017/sparkDemo.bank"))

import org.apache.spark.sql.SparkSession
val spark = SparkSession.builder().getOrCreate()

paragraphs.title: Load data from CSV
paragraphs.text:
case class Bank(age: Long, job: String, marital: String, education: String, balance: Integer)

val df = spark.read.options(Map("sep"-> ";", "header" -> "true", "inferSchema" -> "true")).csv("/zeppelin/data/bank.csv")
df.printSchema()

paragraphs.title: Load data from MongoDB

paragraphs.text:
%sql
SELECT age, COUNT(1) number
FROM bank 
WHERE age < ${maxAge=30} 
GROUP BY age 
ORDER BY age

%sql 
SELECT age, COUNT(1) number
FROM bank 
WHERE job = "unemployed"
GROUP BY age 
ORDER BY age

%sql 
SELECT age, COUNT(1) number
FROM bank 
WHERE marital="${marital=single,single|divorced|married}" 
GROUP BY age 
ORDER BY age

%md
## SQL Queries under the hood:

    SELECT age, COUNT(1) number
    FROM bank 
    WHERE age < 30
    GROUP BY age 
    ORDER BY age

The same as the following:

    bankData.groupBy("age").count().withColumnRenamed("count", "number").filter("age < 30").orderBy("age")

Runs the following MongoDB Aggregation:

    [{ "$match" : { "age" : { "$lt" : 30 } } }, { "$project" : { "age" : 1, "_id" : 0 } }]

result.msg:
SQL Queries under the hood:

SELECT age, COUNT(1) number
FROM bank 
WHERE age < 30
GROUP BY age 
ORDER BY age

The same as the following:

bankData.groupBy("age").count().withColumnRenamed("count", "number").filter("age < 30").orderBy("age")

Runs the following MongoDB Aggregation:

[{ "$match" : { "age" : { "$lt" : 30 } } }, { "$project" : { "age" : 1, "_id" : 0 } }]
